title: Street fighting in Mariupol and hypersonic missiles: Ukraine war daily round-up
description: Fierce fighting on Mariupol's streets, and Russia denies its cosmonauts wore Ukrainian colours in space.

title: From waitress to cafe owner, all while still a teenager
description: Chloe Campbell was 15 when she got a job in a Moray cafe - four years later she is the new boss.

title: Ukraine: Brit finds refugee to host after Polish trip
description: A British man who flew to Poland to find a refugee to host says he is waiting to bring him to the UK.

title: Ukraine conflict: Scores feared dead after Russia attack on Mykolaiv barracks
description: A source tells the BBC that up to 200 soldiers were at the Mykolaiv barracks when missiles hit.

title: Hodgkinson pulls out of World Indoor Championships 800m because of injury
description: Ukraine's Yaroslava Mahuchikh wins an emotional gold in the women's high jump at the World Athletics Indoor Championships in Belgrade.

title: Clerkenwell murder probe after woman, 19, dies
description: A woman has died after being found with serious injuries at a student halls in central London.

title: Ukraine: Fire engine convoy leaves UK with vital supplies for firefighters
description: The 22 vehicles containing equipment offered from across the UK will reach Poland in three days.

title: Russians board International Space Station in Ukrainian colours
description: Three cosmonauts ditch the standard-issue Russian uniforms in an apparent show of solidarity.

title: Women's World Cup: Australia batters achieve record run chase to beat India - highlights
description: Watch Australia's best shots as they complete the highest chase in Women's World Cup history to beat India and reach the semi-finals.

title: War in Ukraine: Gordon Brown backs Nuremberg-style trial for Putin
description: Gordon Brown and Sir John Major join calls for an international tribunal to investigate Russia.

title: Australia book Women's World Cup semi spot
description: Australia complete the highest chase in Women's World Cup history to beat India and reach the semi-finals.

title: Biggar and Jones set for milestones as Wales host Italy
description: Team news, match preview and statistics for Saturday's match between Wales and Italy at the Principality Stadium.

title: Disability: Bedbound Gwynedd woman can only stare at ceiling
description: A rare genetic condition has left Jenny Rowbory bedbound for more than a decade.

title: High-definition France bring England struggles into focus
description: France are fully focused on their Grand Slam bid but England are searching for direction and shape as the pressure grows on head coach Eddie Jones.

title: Lupin: Seven charged over armed heist on Paris filming set
description: Around 20 hooded attackers used fireworks to steal €300,000 worth of equipment from the crew.

title: Comic Relief: Red Nose Day raises £42m in star-studded show
description: Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders, Matt Lucas and David Walliams featured in the Red Nose Day broadcast.

title: Assad: Syria's leader makes historic visit to UAE
description: It marks Bashar al-Assad's first visit to an Arab country since the Syrian civil war began in 2011.

title: UK's safe level for tap water too high - scientists
description: Experts say the UK should reduce the amount of toxic "forever chemicals" allowed in drinking water.

title: How Kremlin accounts manipulate Twitter
description: One of the prime sources for fake news on Twitter comes straight from the Kremlin's network of Twitter accounts.

title: Ukraine: How crowdsourcing is rescuing people from the war zone
description: Volunteers inside and outside Ukraine are working together to help civilians escape the war safely.

title: Ukraine war: Putin has redrawn the world - but not the way he wanted
description: Because of his miscalculations, there's a new iron curtain at the Russian leader’s door - writes Allan Little

title: Ukraine: What have been Russia's military mistakes?
description: Senior Western defence and intelligence experts outline the battlefield errors made by Moscow.

title: Sri Lanka tests UN's patience on human rights
description: President Rajapaksa is resisting efforts to investigate alleged war crimes and improve a dismal rights record.

title: Tanzania viewpoint: What President Samia has achieved in her first year
description: After years of authoritarian rule, there are signs of change under the country's first female leader.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's release: 'If any couple is going to survive this, it's them'
description: How the bond between Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe and her family helped them endure the darkest of times.

title: French elections: Putin's war gives Macron boost in presidential race
description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has shaken up France's presidential elections, with only three weeks to go.

title: Week in pictures: 12 - 18 March 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Ukraine war: From wedding dresses to camouflage capes
description: A group of Ukrainian seamstresses who fled the war are helping by making camouflage capes for soldiers.

title: Hong Kong: 'My employer kicked me out because I caught Covid'
description: 'Lenlen' is one of several foreign domestic workers made homeless amid Hong Kong's Covid wave.

title: Ukraine war: Jewish children airlifted to Israel
description: In Israel, some 90 Ukrainian children have been dressing up for the joyful Jewish holiday of Purim.
